It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and knotweeds, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy bracts that resemble petals. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by vibrant, leaf-like structures that serve as a primary means of attracting pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
